SENT.plain: A 2-week-old male is presented with the clinical findings of the autosomal dominant Townes-Brocks syndrome in an otherwise unaffected family
The patient showed the full spectrum of anomalies including imperforate anus, perineal fistula, triphalangeal thumb, preaxial polydactyly, pre-auricular tags, and microtia
As there is considerable overlap with the VACTERL association, careful examination of the parents is necessary with regard to the genetic counselling risk
